sect3.title: Nested ternary operators without explicit parentheses
sect3.para:
Nested ternary operations must explicitly use parentheses to dictate the order of the operations. Previously, when used without parentheses, the left-associativity would not result in the expected behaviour in most cases.
<?php 1 ? 2 : 3 ? 4 : 5; // deprecated (1 ? 2 : 3) ? 4 : 5; // ok 1 ? 2 : (3 ? 4 : 5); // ok ?>

sect3.title: Array and string offset access using curly braces
sect3.para: The array and string offset access syntax using curly braces is deprecated. Use $var[$idx] instead of $var{$idx}.

sect3.title: (real) cast and is_real function
sect3.para: The (real) cast is deprecated, use (float) instead.
The is_real function is also deprecated, use is_float instead.

sect3.title: Unbinding $this when $this is used
sect3.para: Unbinding $this of a non-static closure that uses $this is deprecated.

sect3.title: parent keyword without parent class
sect3.para: Using parent inside a class without a parent is deprecated, and will throw a compile-time error in the future. Currently an error will only be generated if/when the parent is accessed at run-time.

sect3.title: allow_url_include INI option
sect3.para: The allow_url_include ini directive is deprecated. Enabling it will generate a deprecation notice at startup.

sect3.title: Invalid characters in base conversion functions
sect3.para: Passing invalid characters to base_convert, bindec, octdec and hexdec will now generate a deprecation notice. The result will still be computed as if the invalid characters did not exist. Leading and trailing whitespace, as well as prefixes of type 0x (depending on base) continue to be allowed.

sect3.title: Using array_key_exists on objects
sect3.para: Using array_key_exists on objects is deprecated. Instead either isset or property_exists should be used.

sect3.title: Magic quotes functions
sect3.para: The get_magic_quotes_gpc and get_magic_quotes_runtime functions are deprecated. They always return &false;.

sect3.title: hebrevc function
sect3.para: The hebrevc function is deprecated. It can be replaced with nl2br(hebrev($str)) or, preferably, the use of Unicode RTL support.

sect3.title: convert_cyr_string function
sect3.para: The convert_cyr_string function is deprecated. It can be replaced by one of mb_convert_string, iconv or UConverter.

sect3.title: money_format function
sect3.para: The money_format function is deprecated. It can be replaced by the intl NumberFormatter functionality.

sect3.title: restore_include_path function
sect3.para: The restore_include_path function is deprecated. It can be replaced by ini_restore('include_path').

sect3.title: Implode with historical parameter order
sect3.para: Passing parameters to implode in reverse order is deprecated, use implode($glue, $parts) instead of implode($parts, $glue).

sect2.title: COM
sect2.para: Importing type libraries with case-insensitive constant registering has been deprecated.

sect2.title: Filter
sect2.para: FILTER_SANITIZE_MAGIC_QUOTES is deprecated, use FILTER_SANITIZE_ADD_SLASHES instead.

sect2.title: Multibyte String
sect2.para: Passing a non-string pattern to mb_ereg_replace is deprecated. Currently, non-string patterns are interpreted as ASCII codepoints. In PHP 8, the pattern will be interpreted as a string instead.
Passing the encoding as 3rd parameter to mb_strrpos is deprecated. Instead pass a 0 offset, and encoding as 4th parameter.

sect2.title: Lightweight Directory Access Protocol
sect2.para: ldap_control_paged_result_response and ldap_control_paged_result are deprecated. Pagination controls can be sent along with ldap_search instead.

sect2.title: Reflection
sect2.para: Calls to ReflectionType::__toString now generate a deprecation notice. This method has been deprecated in favor of ReflectionNamedType::getName in the documentation since PHP 7.1, but did not throw a deprecation notice for technical reasons.

sect2.title: Socket
sect2.para: The AI_IDN_ALLOW_UNASSIGNED and AI_IDN_USE_STD3_ASCII_RULES flags for socket_addrinfo_lookup are deprecated, due to an upstream deprecation in glibc.
